labelLink.label:
Tuple: parent container for account numbers and identifiers. No entry is made here, but each detail line may have multiple accounts assigned to it for reporting in different GAAPs, offsetting accounts in Japan, passing along information to consolidation systems about local versus consolidating accounts, etc. For example, the account 4783HG-QOWI-192837-1000 may be expressed so:
/account/accountMainID 1000 /account/accountMainDescription Cash /account/accountSub/accountSubID 4783HG /account/accountSub/accountSubDescription Department /account/accountSub/accountSubID QOWI /account/accountSub/accountSubDescription Branch /account/accountSub/accountSubID 192837 /account/accountSub/accountSubDescription Division
Account Identifier
Root for XBRL GL. No entry made here.
Accounting Entries
Description of accountMainID - the human readable describer that accompanies the code used in accountMainID
Main Account Description

Main account - the code used to identify the accounting bucket the entry has been assigned to. Examples might be 1000 for Cash, 567GAAZ for Sales Expense or Z for tax payments. Identifiers such as department, branch, division, manager, or other modifiers are noted in the Subaccount area. Before needing to post, account is not necessary. Posting to the general ledger almost always requires an entry here.
Main Account Number

Code related to usage for account aggregate - Consolidating, European, IFRS, Offsetting, Primary, Tax, USGAAP, Japanese, Other. Japanese companies will use this for the tax required offsetting entry. If left blank, assumes default accounting method for company.
Purpose of Account
Description of usage for aggregate account
Description of Purpose of Account
The description that accompanies accountSubID belongs here.
Subaccount Description
Tuple to hold multiple accountSubIDs and Descriptions
Subaccount Information
Where the primary account was placed in accountMainID, the code used for each profit center, division, business unit, fund, program, branch, project, class, su-class or other modifier is placed here.
Subaccount

Type of sub-account - profit center, division, business unit, fund, program, branch, project, class, su-class or other modifier is placed here. For example:: Accountability center: Business unit: Class:Department: Project: Fund: Program:Job: Profit center: Branch: Setup class: Division: Unit
Type of Subaccount
Type of account
Account Type

This field (amount) represents the primary monetary amount related to the subject of the entryDetail line. There is one primary monetary amount per entryDetail structure. It may, for example, represent the amount of one line of a journal entry, the balance on a document, or the extended amount of a line item on an invoice. Amount is not required if detailed entry is used for non-financial work and other elements are populated, in particular measurableQuantity. The amount field is a signed number (either positive or negative itself) and used in conjunction with a separate signOfAmount and a separate debitCreditCode, which together are considered for understanding the monetary amount. The unit of measure is determined by amountCurrency if present, and by the default or home currency if amountCurrency is not present.
Monetary Amount
Enumerated field with possible values of permanent, temporary or none indicating the type of difference between book and tax accounting methods. Omission of this field is equivalent to "none"
Type of Difference Between Book and Tax
Date of confirmation of shipment/receipt.
Confirmation Date
Date/time file was created.
Creation Date
Date of acknowledgement of goods/services shipped/received.
Acknowledgement Date
Optional identifier of whether the amount is a (D)ebit, a (C)redit or Undefined
Debit/Credit Identifier
Description of this line of detail only
Description

Document number of primary invoice number, used to offset payments, debits and credits; for an invoice, usually the same as the documentNumber. When calculating open balance on an invoice, or open amount on payments in advance or not fully applied, this permits calculation of the open item.
Apply To Number
Date (and less likely in the paper world but possible in the e-world, time) on actual document (invoice, voucher, check date). Other dates control posting information.
Document Date
Parent for descriptive information about the accountingEntries section in which it is contained.
Document Information
Invoice, check, voucher, or other source document identifier
Document Number
Internal reference for the document above; number assigned internally to track the document
Document Reference
An enumerated field describing the original source document, with invoice, voucher, check and other enumerated entries
Document Type
Initials/name of operator originally entering.
Entry Creator
Represents the actual date/time of entry into computer (automated from system date, often misrepresented by changing system clock). Posting dates are maintained separately.
Entry Date
Holder for entity information - information about the reporting organization.
Entity Information section
Text for entire document.
Document Comment

Entry Qualifier - An enumerated field that qualifies the type of entry, specifically useful for general ledger and trial balance environments when it is important to state the values represented are summarized as of the reporting date - opening or closing balances. In accounting systems, this is often known as BBF (balance brought forward.) Permitted values are: standard, balance-brought-forward and other.
Entry Qualifier

account: information to fill in a chart of accounts file. balance: the results of accumulation of a complete and validated list of entries for an account (or a list of account) in a specific period - sometimes called general ledger entries: a list of individual accounting entries, which might be posted/validated or nonposted/validated journal: a self-balancing (Dr = Cr) list of entries for a specific period including beginning balance for that period. ledger: a complete list of entries for a specific account (or list of accounts) for a specific period; note - debits do not have to equal credits. assets: a listing of open receivables, payables, inventory, fixed assets or other information that can be extracted from but are not necessarily included as part of a journal entry. trialBalance: the self-balancing (Dr = Cr) result of accumulation of a complete and validated list of entries for the entity in a complete list of accounts in a specific period. taxtables: aids automated interpretation of instances that represent tax tables; Tax table are defined by using multiple [taxes] structures to gather the population of codes, authorities and rates; through [taxTableCode] cross-references in the [taxes] structure, these "master file" tax tables can be referenced.
Often sorted by date or by account, these terms have specific, and sometimes different, meanings in different areas. Common practice will drive accounting method/term matches.
Document Type
Description of entry described by this entry header (e.g. Opening Balance)
Entry Description
Parent for entry detail
Entry Detail
Parent for entry headers/journal entry headers.
Entry Information
Identifier within source journal
Entry Identifier
One of the following enumerated list: adjusting, budget, comparative, external-accountant, standard, passed-adjusting, eliminating, proposed, recurring, reclassifying, simulated, tax, other
Type Identifier
For use as Customer, Vendor or Employee Class (such as Residential/Commercial/Institutional/Government or Retail/Wholesale or other classifications used by business).
Identifier Category
Internal ID Number associated with identifierReference
ID Number (internal)
Textual description of identifierReference.
Identifier Description
Email address for Identifier.
Email Address
Phone number related to Identifier.
Phone Number
Identification for customer, vendor, or employee.
Identifier Reference
External Authority (e,g, Tax Authority) ID Number associated with identifierReference
External Authority ID Number
Entity type (enumerated): e.g., customer, vendor, employee.
Identifier Type
Primary language of the intellectual content. Where practical, the content of this field should coincide with ISO 639-1988 language codes.
Language
Identifier for a particular entry detail
Line Number

Account type - FASB Concepts 6 and similar international designs. When xbrlInfo is used to associated other XBRL reporting items, this field is more suited to representing existing systems (audit) than data interchange.
Account Classification
Due date or other maturity date.
Maturity Date or Date Due
Roll up item from child natural account to parent natural account.
Parent Account Number
Subaccount NUMBER this subaccount rolls up to - see also subaccount type it rolls up to.
Parent Subaccount Code
For partial allocations of amounts to different parents, the percentage of a child that will be allocated to a parent.
Parent Subaccount Percentage
The describer of the segment this subaccount rolls up to.
Parent Subaccount Type
Start of date range for contents. Used as basis for many assumptions about data, including the date as of which open balances are open.
Period Covered Start
End of date range for contents. Used as basis for many assumptions about data, including the date as of which open balances are open.
Period Covered End
Date this entry was posted (validated) to the general ledger. May not represent the date of accounting significance which is represented by 'postingDate'.
Date Posted

At the detail level, this represents the accounting significance date. No matter what date the document is received, entered, or posted, this signifies the accounting date of the entry. If you want to see the financial results for March 5, 2002 and this entry is given that date, the entry will be part of the results for March 5, 2002. This is different from the postedDate found at the entryHeader level. If you want the accounting significance to be a particular date, it goes here. A single entry could represent multiple dates, but would only be posted on one date.
Posting Date

deferred: although entered, it cannot be posted until a later time posted: already posted proposed: a proposed item that must be approved simulated: a simulated item, for what-if tax: a tax-specific entry unposted:entered but not yet posted or validated cancelled:entered and later cancelled other:other status - should be described in postingStatusDescription
Posting Status
Used for representing descriptions of reporting trees.
Reporting Tree Identifier
Provides guidance on action to take with previous set of data: supersedes - old data should be considered as obsolete/overwritten; supplements - belongs with that data as if it was included with it.
Action to Take with Previous Data

If this batch of information revises a previous batch of information, this field identifies the previous batch that is being revised. 'uniqueID' of the previous batch goes here. Developers should consider exception reporting.
Revises Audit Number
Tuple for showing the detail necessary to roll up from one segment (type of subaccount) to another.)
Segment Parent Information
Date goods/services are shipped/received.
Date Shipped/Received

Sign of amount; provides 4 possible fields only when used in conjunction with debitCreditCode; primarily used for correcting entries so total debits and credits after an entry error are not inflated. D + increase DebitsD - decrease debitsC + decreases creditC - increases credit
Sign Indication for Amount

Source journal. The code of the journal in which the entry is processed. The code must be a unique indication for a journal and is selected from the following enumerated list:
cd cash disbursements (sending cheques to vendors) cr cash receipts (receiving cheques from others) fa fixed assets gi giro/other bank adjustments gj general journal im inventory management jc job cost pj purchase journal (liabilities from purchases) pl payroll journal sj sales journal se standard entries ud user defined ot other sources of entries
Source Journal
Amount of taxes
Amount of Taxes
Basis for taxation
Basis for Taxation
A class or category of taxes
Tax Category
Additional text/code for exemption reasons or other comments.
Tax Comment/Exemption Reason
Description of tax authority
Tax Description
Tuple for holding tax related information
Tax Information
Amount for foreign currency tracking in original currency
Exchange Rate for Tax
Percent rate for VAT or other taxes normally a number between 0 and 1.0 - e.g. 50% is represented as 0.5
Tax Percentage Rate
Discount/payment terms.
Payment Terms
Unique identifier for this file.
Audit Number
Associated XBRL element or XML element within an XML taxonomy - mapping to an XBRL concept.
Summary Reporting Element
Associated XBRL element in XBRL-GL instance.
Detail Matching Element
Indicates that the information being given is beginning_balance, ending_balance, period_change.
XBRL Allocation

This will roll up to XBRL reporting information - this is a parent - repeatable so that the same item can be reported through many taxonomies. Care should be taken to consider what happens if people post to the same account but different xbrl elements.
XBRL Information
Fax Number Structure
Fax number structure related to identifier.
Invoice Type
Invoice Type (self-billed, ePoS enumerated values)
Ship From
References organizationAddressLocationIdentifier where used. Otherwise freeform.
Identifier Contact Prefix
Prefix (e.g. Dr., Mr., Mrs.)
Identifier Contact Information Structure
Identifier Contact Information Structure
Identifier Contact First Name
First or given name
Identifier Contact Suffix
Suffix (e.g. MD, CPA, Jr.)
Identifier Contact Attention Line
Attention Line
Identifier Contact Position/Role
Position or Role
Identifier Contact Phone
Phone Number
Identifier Contact Fax Number
Fax Number
Identifier Contact Email Address
Email Address
Identifier Contact Type
Identifier Contact Type
Identifier Contact Last Name
Identifier Contact Last or Family Name
Identifier Organization Type
Identifier Organization Type
Identifier Contact Phone Number Usage
Identifier Contact Phone Number Usage (Main, Investor Relations, etc.)
Identifier Contact Phone Number
Identifier Contact Phone Number
Identifier Phone Number
Identifier Phone Number
Identifier Phone Number Usage
Identifier Phone Number Usage (e.g. Main, Investor relations, etc.)
Identifer Fax Number
Identifer Fax Number
Identifer Fax Number Usage (e.g. Orders, Head Office, IR)
Identifer Fax Number Usage
Identifer Contact Fax Number Usage
Identifer Contact Fax Number Usage (e.g. Orders, Head Office, IR)
Identifer Contact Fax Number
Identifer Contact Fax Number
Identifer Email Address Usage (e.g. Orders, Head Office, IR)
Identifer Email Address Usage
Identifer Contact Email Address Usage
Identifer Contact Email Address Usage (e.g. Orders, Head Office, IR)
Identifer Contact Email Address
Identifer Contact Email Address
Identifer Email Address
Identifer Email Address
External Authority
Name of External Authority (e.g. Tax Authority)
External Authority Verification Date
Date on which the External Authority last performed a verification
External Authority
Structure containing references to an external authority associated with identifier
Tax Authority
Name of the relevant tax authority
Tax Table Code
Tax table code used by the relevant tax authority
Account Active
Boolean to indicate whether the account is active (="true") or inactive (="false")
Identifier Active
Boolean to indicate whether the identifier is active (="true") or inactive (="false")
Entry Number Counter
Unique reference for the entry - a numeric counter
Line Number Counter
Unique reference for the line - a numeric counter
Free format description of the document type
Document Type Description
Free format description of the account classification
Account Classification Description
Free format description of the posting status
Posting Status Description
Free format description of the entry qualifier
Entry Qualifier Description
Free format description of the account type
